original: A list of top frequently asked  Joomla interview questions  and answers are given below.
result: Below, you will find a compilation of the most commonly asked Joomla interview questions along with their corresponding answers.

original: Joomla is an open source Content Management System (CMS) written in PHP. It is a very popular CMS along with WordPress and Drupal. It facilitates users to develop online applications and websites. Joomla is built on model-view-controller (MVC) web application framework.
result: Joomla is a widely-used Content Management System that is built on MVC web application framework and coded in PHP. It is an open-source platform that allows users to create websites and online applications with ease, alongside WordPress and Drupal.

original: A Mambot is a small, task-oriented function, mini program or plugin. It is used to modify content before display, extend site search, add core functionality etc. Mambots are renamed plugins in Joomla 1.5.
result: A Mambot is a type of plugin or mini program that performs specific tasks. It can be utilized to modify content before it is displayed, enrich site search, or add essential features. In Joomla 1.5, these functionalities are referred to as plugins instead of Mambots.

original: Mambots can be divided into 5 types/categories that are displayed by filtering in the filter field:
result: This text discusses the five types or categories of mambots, which can be easily located using the filter field.

result: The benefits of utilizing Joomla include the following:

original: Joomla is open source and absolutely free to use.
result: Joomla is a software that is freely available and falls under the category of open source. Users can utilize this software without any charge.

original: It provides a lot of free components are available in extensions.joomla.org/
result: The Joomla platform offers users a plethora of free components that can be easily downloaded from extensions.joomla.org/. These components can be useful for expanding the functionality of your website and enhancing the user experience. With a wide range of options to choose from, there is something for every need and preference on the platform's extension directory.

original: It has inbuilt permission and user role.
result: This software possesses built-in functionality to manage user roles and permissions.

original: One click updation.
result: Updating your system or software can be accomplished with just a single click.

original: Provide simple, elegant and user-friendly templates free to use.
result: Our aim is to offer uncomplicated, stylish and intuitive templates that anyone can use for free.

original: Plugin compatibility may cause an issue.
result: One potential problem that may arise is the compatibility of different plugins.

original: Its websites are heavy
result: The websites in question are excessively large and take a long time to load due to their heavy content.

original: Limited server resources and efficiency
result: The resources of a server may be limited, and this may affect its efficiency.

original: When you install Joomla, it has a menu link to the frontpage component which is by default the homepage of a site.
result: In Joomla, the frontpage component is designated as the default homepage of a website, and can be accessed via a built-in menu link.

original: Joomla template displays pages in a specific format. It divides the pages into a number of modules like nav, header, footer, top, bottom, module, etc. This is known as position.
result: A Joomla template is designed to present web pages in a specific layout by dividing them into modules such as nav, header, footer, top, bottom, and module. Each module represents a particular position on the page.

original: Joomla framework has some very useful and advanced features that facilitate developers to build some specific applications and websites very easily and quickly. These are:
result: The Joomla framework boasts several advanced features that enable developers to efficiently create specific websites and applications. Some of these features are especially useful, allowing for fast and easy development.

original: Yes Joomla can also be used as a blogging platform. But other CMS should be preferred over Joomla for blogging purpose.
result: Joomla has the capability to function as a blogging platform, but it may not be the best choice when compared to other content management systems available in the market that are specifically designed for blogging purposes.

original: Joomla supports MySQL database.
result: Joomla has the capability to work with a database management system called MySQL.

original: By default, Joomla have 65 tables.
result: Joomla typically includes 65 tables as part of its default setup.

original: In Joomla CMS, database settings are stored in the root directory under configuration.php.
result: Joomla CMS stores its database settings in the configuration.php file located in the root directory.

original: Joomla have prefix like jos_.
result: Joomla uses a prefix such as "jos_" in its database tables.

original: Modules are the items which can be shown anywhere through the module manager in the administrative interface. They are used to extend the capability of Joomla by adding new functionalities to the software. Modules are installed in the admin section.
result: Modules are components that can be displayed on any page of a website using the module manager in Joomla's administrative interface. They serve to enhance Joomla's functionality by adding new features and capabilities. To install modules, you need to access the admin section of Joomla's platform.

original: A favicon is an icon associated with a particular website, generally displayed in the address bar of the browser. You can change, manage and upload a new favicon by accessing global configuration site tab.
result: A favicon is a small graphic symbol that represents a website and is typically visible in the address bar of a web browser. To modify, organize, or upload a new favicon, you may access the global configuration site tab.

result: We can describe a family website or personnel website as a platform where individuals can share information about themselves or their loved ones to a specific audience.

original: Joomla, Drupal and WordPress all are content management systems written in PHP. Let's check the difference among them.
result: Joomla, Drupal, and WordPress are all popular content management systems that are programmed using PHP. Here are some distinctions between the three.

result: This resource is ideal for people who are new to the subject.

result: A plethora of themes, plugins, and widgets are available on the platform.

result: Website builders like Shopify and WooCommerce are great for businesses selling products online, but they do come with limitations. For more complex e-commerce sites with specific needs, custom development using programming languages may be necessary. This approach requires technical knowledge in coding and implementation.

result: This is an option for web development that is both user-friendly and more complex.

result: This particular content is challenging but also the most dominant CMS available.

result: Our decision is to select the choice of worldwide data.

result: The index.php file loads the Loader.php file, which provides the menu bar.

original: Despite of the fact that Joomla is intended for web applications but we can also control some desktop applications. Joomla server can communicate with desktop applications by following some standard protocols.
result: Joomla is primarily designed for creating web-based applications. However, it is possible to manage certain desktop applications using Joomla. By adhering to established protocols, the Joomla server can interact with desktop applications.

original: Breadcrumb displays hierarchical representation with click able links for the users to determine where they are in the web site and allow them to navigate back.
result: A breadcrumb is a navigation aid that shows the website's hierarchical structure and provides clickable links for users to easily determine their current location and navigate back.

original: It is a short description of the page in an optional paragraph which is displayed in the results of search engines.
result: A meta description is a brief summary of a webpage that appears in search engine results as an optional paragraph.

original: Extension manager extends the functionality of a Joomla website.
result: An extension manager is a tool that enhances the functionality of a Joomla website. It adds extra features and capabilities to the site.

original: The Feed Display Module shows the RSS news feeds from a web site. It provides updated content to its user from other resources.
result: The Feed Display Module is a tool that can be used to display RSS news feeds on a website. This module provides users with updated content from various sources.

original: This module displays the user's information that is accessing the web site.
result: This component showcases the details of the person currently using the website.

original: Content items can be defined as the HTML pages which are created and managed by the admin. Joomla has various categories of content items like X-category has 0 or more content pages. We can further classify categories in sections as one category has 0 more sections.
result: Content items refer to the web pages that are produced and administered by the admin of a Joomla website. Joomla offers a range of categories for content items, such as the X-category, which can have zero or multiple content pages, and categories can be further subcategorized into sections, where a single category can have zero or more sections.
